en.HELP_MESSAGE: You can say tell me can I get a tube fact, or, you can say exit... What can I help you with?
en.HELP_REPROMPT: What can I help you with?
en.FALLBACK_MESSAGE: The Tube Facts skill can't help you with that.  It can help you discover facts about the tube if you say tell me a tube fact. What can I help you with?
en.FALLBACK_REPROMPT: What can I help you with?
FACTS: The southernmost tube station is Morden
The only station with an apostrophe is St John's Wood.
The largest roundel on the underground can be found at Brixton Station.
Currently on the tube map, Reading is the western most station
The Bakerloo Line has its namesake through it's old termini, Baker Street and Waterloo
The Metropolitan Line is The Longest Line on the underground
The furthest distance between two stations is Chesham and Chalfont and Latimer, at a distance of 6300 meters
The shortest distance between two stations is Leicester Square and Covent Garden
On average, the Metropolitan Line is the fastest, clocking speeds of over 60mph
The Bakerloo Line has the oldest traims, being put into servic in 1972.
Angel contains the longest escelator on the network.
The District Line has the most stations, at 60.
Despite being called the underground, the stations of Chesham, Amersham, Chalfont and Latimer, Chorleywood and Epping all fall outside the M25
Kensington Olympia is the least served tube station.
Battersea Park is the only Overground Station not to be listed on the map
